title: Kent Quality Foods, Inc. Recalls Ready-To-Eat Sausage Products due to Possible Foreign Matter Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, July 26, 2019 Kent Quality Foods, Inc., a Grand Rapids, Mich. establishment, is recalling approximately 48,681 pounds of ready-to-eat polish sausage with beef products that may be contaminated with extraneous materials, specifically pieces of flexible pink rubber, the U.S. Department of Agricultures Food Safety...
impacted_products: TETON WATERS RANCH COOKED UNCURED POLISH SAUSAGE MADE WITH BEEF
